intro: Lastreopsis nigritiana, commonly known as the black-stemmed broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its distinctive blackish stems and yellow flowers make it easily recognizable, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
